In general, when offering to the gods of the eight directions, first prepare the offered food and drink. Cook a thick porridge of the five flavors
without making it too thin.
The five flavors are glutinous rice, mung beans, sesame, cow's milk, and ghee.
Each is measured according to quantity.
Use your discretion to make it flavorful.
Add a little salt, but be sure to keep it pure.
Serve it in a porcelain bowl.
Twelve small wax candles and white sandalwood incense.
Seasonal flowers and clean water at the place of offering.
In the eight directions, each set up a small altar.
On the small altar, first place a clean bowl.
Have someone hold the porridge and incense flowers, following the reciter.

The reciter should first sincerely invite the Heavenly Kings of the eight directions and their retinues to come to the ritual arena and each abide in their original positions. First, in the east, recite the mantra of Indra.
First, wash with a little clean water, then apply the unguent.
Next, offer seasonal flowers, porridge, and beeswax candles inserted into the porridge, and burn incense three times.
Recite the mantra with your mouth and request protection.
Beg for the joy of the Heavenly King and the blessings of the ritual master.
Next, in the southeast and fire direction, do the same.
Offer in order, reciting the mantra of each deity.

Clearly remember the sequence of the items below.
First water, then unguent, then flowers, then porridge, then candles, then incense. After going through all the positions,
then recite the mantra of Mount Sumeru.
Empower it with three, seven, or five, seven recitations.
The mantra states:
Om Sume Ru Karpaye. Om Sume Ru Sume Ru Palu Sume Ru Palu Sume Ru Naya Svaha. After completing the offerings, then wash the hands.
Also offer to the assembly of sages in the ritual arena, see them off, and send them away.
Collect back the offering items.
Then anoint the altar.

The mantra of the Brahma Heaven above is: Namo, Om, Marah, Ham, Ning, Ning, Ning, Svaha. The mantra of the Earth Heaven below is: Om, Prite, Viye, Svaha. Each of the six items such as water should be held by one person and placed behind the donor.
After the offering, the donor should stand in the place where the offerings have not yet been made.
In this way, they must be taken in order.
The candles must be carefully attended to.
Before the offerings are completed, they must not be allowed to go out.
The mantra of the Sun God is: Om, Saha, Sarva, Graha, Durbhara, Hrum, Dule, Svaha. The mantra of the Moon God is: Om, Soma, Pratisa, Hrum, Svaha.

on the day of completing the practice in the ritual arena, in the first watch of the night,
they must first offer to the eight directional celestial kings, Brahma, the celestial beings, the various stars and planets, ghosts and spirits, etc.,
and then dismiss the holy assembly.
If one acts in this way in accordance with the Dharma, starting from the abandonment of the ritual arena,
All sages and worthies will rejoice and bring blessings.
